svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

This class is the foundation exception descriptor for the I2C transaction class. The exceptions are errors that may be introduced into transaction, for the purpose of testing how the DUT responds.

Member Function Documentation

  function svt_pattern
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::allocate_pattern
 (   ) 

HDL Support: This method allocates a pattern containing svt_pattern_data instances for all of the primitive data fields in the object. The svt_pattern_data :: name is set to the corresponding field name, the svt_pattern_data :: value is set to 0.

Return values - An svt_pattern instance containing entries for all of the data fields.

  function bit
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::decode_prop_val
 (  string prop_name , bit [1023:0] prop_val , ref string prop_val_string , input svt_pattern_data :: type_enum typ  ) 

Simple utility used to convert 'bit [1023:0]' property value representation into its equivalent string property value representation. Extended to support decoding of enum values.

prop_name - The name of the property being encoded.

prop_val_string - The string describing the value to be encoded.

prop_val - The bit vector encoding of prop_val_string.

typ - Optional field type used to help in the encode effort.

Return values - Status indicating the success/failure of the decode.

 Superseded functions 
 svt_sequence_item_base :: decode_prop_val

  function void
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::set_constraint_weights
 (  int new_weight  ) 

Sets the randomize weights for all *_wt attributes except NO_OP_ERROR_wt to new_weight.

new_weight - Value to set all *_wt attributes to (NO_OP_ERROR_wt is not updated).

 rand bit [3:0]   attribute
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::byte_bit_pos = 4

Configures the position of tag in a command or write data byte. If 1, the tag will be inserted after 1st bit of the byte.

 rand int  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::data_byte_pos = 1

Configures the position of the tag (Start/Stop) in write data bytes. If 1, the tag will be inserted in 1st write data byte

 rand int  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::no_of_s_p_pattrn = 1

Configures the number of START->STOP pattern to be inserted

 rand int  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::no_of_tags = 1

Configures the number of START or STOP conditions that are to be inserted.

 protected int  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::NO_OP_ERROR_wt = 1

Weight controlling frequency of NO_OP_ERROR.

This attribute is required to be greater than 0, but will normally be much less than the other _wt values. If this value less than 1 then pre_randomize will set NO_OP_ERROR_wt to 1 and issue a warning message.

 rand bit  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::p_at_cmd_data = 1

Configures the STOP condition insertion either in command or data byte
  • 0 : Insert STOP in command byte
  • 1 : Insert STOP in Data byte

 int  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::PEC_ERROR_wt = 1000

Distribution weight controlling the frequency of random PEC_ERROR error

 rand bit  attribute
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::retry_txn = 0

Configures wether to retry or flush the transaction after inserting the error

Member Typedef Documentation

 typedef enum  svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::error_kind_enum
A transaction exception identifies the kind of error to be injected
DATA_SIZE_LESS_THAN_8_BIT_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_DATA_SIZE_LESS_THAN_8_BIT_ERROR )
Data byte with less than 8 bits is transmitted
SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_STOP_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_STOP_ERROR )
Setup time for stop violated
SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_DATA_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_DATA_ERROR )
Setup time for data violated
HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_START_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_START_ERROR )
Hold time for start violated
HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_DATA_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_DATA_ERROR )
Hold time for data violated
INVALID_TBUF_TIME_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_INVALID_TBUF_TIME_ERROR )
Tbuf time violated
INVALID_HIGH_CLK_DURATION_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_INVALID_HIGH_CLK_DURATION_ERROR )
SCL High Time violated
INVALID_LOW_CLK_DURATION_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_INVALID_LOW_CLK_DURATION_ERROR )
SCL Low Time violated
MASTER_CODE_NOT_SENT_IN_HS_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_MASTER_CODE_NOT_SENT_IN_HS_ERROR )
Master doesnot send master code in HS mode
NO_OP_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_NO_OP_ERROR )
This error kind selects no error
ACK_ON_LAST_READ_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_MST_ACK_LAST_READ_ERROR )
Master sends ACK on the last read byte instead of NACK
NACK_ON_RANDOM_READ_BYTE_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_MST_NACK_RANDOM_READ_ERROR )
Master, at random, responds with NACK on any read byte
START_STOP_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_MST_START_STOP_ERROR )
Master generates START condition, immediately followed by STOP condition
ACK_FOR_MASTER_CODE_HS_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_MST_ACK_FOR_MASTER_CODE_HS_ERROR )
Master generates ACK for MASTER CODE (instead of NACK)
MISSING_START_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_MST_MISSING_START_ERROR )
Master starts transaction without START condition
ABORT_TRANS_RANDOM_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_MST_ABORT_TRANS_RANDOM_ERROR )
Master aborts transaction randomly
PEC_ERROR( `SVT_I2C_MST_PEC_ERROR )
STOP_IN_BYTE( `SVT_I2C_MST_STOP_IN_BYTE )
Master generates STOP in the middle of command or write data byte
FALSE_STOP_BEFORE_START( `SVT_I2C_MST_FALSE_STOP_BEFORE_START )
Master generates 'n' number of STOP conditions, where minimum value of n is 1
START_FOLLOWED_BY_START( `SVT_I2C_MST_START_FOLLOWED_BY_START )
Master generates 'n' number of START conditions, where minimum value of n is 1
START_IN_BYTE( `SVT_I2C_MST_START_IN_BYTE )
Master generates START in the middle of command or write data byte
SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_REP_START( `SVT_I2C_MST_SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_REP_START )
Master violates setup time for repeated START
NO_SR_OR_P_GEN_AFTER_NACK( `SVT_I2C_MST_NO_SR_OR_P_GEN_AFTER_NACK )
Master does not generate Rep Start or Stop after NACK is received on bus for write data

Member Constraint Documentation

  constraint
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::distribution_error_kind

Maintains the error distribution based on the assigned weights.
constraint distribution_error_kind {
    error_kind dist
    {
      DATA_SIZE_LESS_THAN_8_BIT_ERROR := DATA_SIZE_LESS_THAN_8_BIT_ERROR_wt,
      SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_STOP_ERROR := SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_STOP_ERROR_wt,
      SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_DATA_ERROR := SETUP_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_DATA_ERROR_wt,
      HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_START_ERROR := HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_START_ERROR_wt,
      HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_DATA_ERROR := HOLD_TIME_VIOLATION_FOR_DATA_ERROR_wt,
      INVALID_TBUF_TIME_ERROR := INVALID_TBUF_TIME_ERROR_wt,
      INVALID_HIGH_CLK_DURATION_ERROR := INVALID_HIGH_CLK_DURATION_ERROR_wt,
      INVALID_LOW_CLK_DURATION_ERROR := INVALID_LOW_CLK_DURATION_ERROR_wt,
      MASTER_CODE_NOT_SENT_IN_HS_ERROR := MASTER_CODE_NOT_SENT_IN_HS_ERROR_wt,
      NO_OP_ERROR := NO_OP_ERROR_wt,
      ACK_ON_LAST_READ_ERROR := ACK_ON_LAST_READ_ERROR_wt,
      NACK_ON_RANDOM_READ_BYTE_ERROR := NACK_ON_RANDOM_READ_BYTE_ERROR_wt,
      START_STOP_ERROR := START_STOP_ERROR_wt,
      ACK_FOR_MASTER_CODE_HS_ERROR := ACK_FOR_MASTER_CODE_HS_ERROR_wt,
      MISSING_START_ERROR := MISSING_START_ERROR_wt,
      ABORT_TRANS_RANDOM_ERROR := ABORT_TRANS_RANDOM_ERROR_wt,
      PEC_ERROR := PEC_ERROR_wt,
      STOP_IN_BYTE := STOP_IN_BYTE_wt,
      FALSE_STOP_BEFORE_START := FALSE_STOP_BEFORE_START_wt,
      START_FOLLOWED_BY_START := START_FOLLOWED_BY_START_wt,
      START_IN_BYTE := START_IN_BYTE_wt
     };
  }

  constraint
 svt_i2c_master_transaction_exception::valid_ranges

valid_ranges constraints/prevent illegal and/or not supported by the Protocol & VIP
constraint valid_ranges {
    no_of_tags inside {[1:50]};
    data_byte_pos inside {[1:1024]};
    byte_bit_pos inside {[1:8]};
    no_of_s_p_pattrn inside {[1:50]};
  }
